intro: Machaerium acutifolium var. acutifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are pinnate, with elongated, pointed leaflets, and it produces yellow to orange flowers during the wet season. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and riverbanks.
